Description: Rim sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice or Type B kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black; top of rim glazed; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis) (noted in Gardner's plate)
Curator's comments: The size of the sherd, the lack of diagnostic elements and the absence of decoration on the interior and exterior surfaces make it impossible to determine whether it came from a kantharos or a chalice. Simple Animal Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior. Given the size of the sherd, it may come from an undecorated part of the chalice. Kantharoi Type B (See Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 169) have very little decoration as well. The number '33' is written in pencil on the sherd's exterior.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 63, no. 726, pl. XXI, no. 726)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 679, no. 377, pl. 21.1.14)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1496) (phase 2)
